meanings.definition: The belief in a single origin or source.
meanings.sent1: Many scientists study monogenesis to understand how everything may have started from one point.
meanings.sent2: The idea of monogenesis suggests that all things can be traced back to a single beginning.
meanings.sent3: Some people find it fascinating to explore the concept of monogenesis and its implications for our understanding of existence.
meanings.sent4: In discussions about the universe's creation, monogenesis serves as a key concept to ponder.
meanings.sent5: The notion of monogenesis simplifies complex ideas about the origins of various phenomena.

meanings.definition: The process of originating from a single source.
meanings.sent1: The study of monogenesis helps us comprehend how diverse things can stem from one common point.
meanings.sent2: Monogenesis explains how different elements can all come from a singular starting point.
meanings.sent3: It's like a recipe where all ingredients come together in a monogenesis of flavors.
meanings.sent4: The growth of a tree from a single seed showcases the concept of monogenesis in nature.
meanings.sent5: The idea of monogenesis simplifies the complex idea of multiple origins into one simple beginning.

meanings.definition: The theory that all living organisms have a single common ancestor.
meanings.sent1: Biologists study monogenesis to explore the idea of a shared ancestry among all living beings.
meanings.sent2: Monogenesis proposes that every living creature can be linked back to a single forebear.
meanings.sent3: Imagine a family reunion where every species is connected through a monogenesis family tree.
meanings.sent4: The concept of monogenesis unites all life forms under one ancestral umbrella.
meanings.sent5: The theory of monogenesis simplifies the complex web of life into a single ancestral thread.
